Some known bugs/quirks of Optical Structure Recognition:

 • it only works (sometimes) on condensed structural formulae (sorry),
 • it sometimes mishandles isomers (1-propanol intepreted as isopropanol),
 • it does not work exceptionally-well/at-all on large molecules.
 • what we are trying to say is, if you can load the molecule via .mol file, do so.


Why do some .mol files display molecules in 3D, but some do not?

 • because calculating the 3D coordinates of a given molecule is real hardwork, and
 • most of the time, .mol files are only required to display a 2D chemical structure any way (chemdraw, etc)


To determine if a .mol file is 2D or 3D, simply render it.


Why is the main app in a landscape configuration?

 • molen carry out image manipulation using openCV. The Android implementation of openCV defaults to a landscape output. We are looking at writing a custom interface in the future to fix this.


What about custom AR markers?

 • As far as we can tell, fitting a custom AR marker is extremely finicky. There are no immediate plans to implement custom AR markers.
